snippet: American fourth and eighth graders continued to fall behind students in several East Asian countries and some European nations, according to new test results.
abstract: Reports from Trends in International Mathematics and Science Study and the Progress in International Reading Literacy Study find American fourth- and eighth-grade students continue to lag behind students in several East Asian countries and some European nations in math and science; issue of how American schools compare with those in other countries has been heated source of debate in education circles for years.
lead_paragraph: American fourth and eighth graders continued to fall behind students in several East Asian countries and some European nations, according to new test results.

headline.seo: U.S. Students Still Lag Globally in Math and Science, Tests Show
headline.main: U.S. Students Still Lag Globally in Math and Science, Tests Show
headline.print_headline: U.S. Students Still Lag Globally In Math and Science, Tests Show

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
